text: Ernanodontidae is an extinct family of pangolin-like insectivorous mammals which were endemic to Asia from the late Paleocene to the early Eocene, 58.7—55.8 Ma existing for approximately .S. Ding. (1979.) "A new edentate from the Paleocene of Guandong." Vertebrata PalAsiatica 17:57-64 ==Classification and phylogeny== ===Classification=== * Suborder: †Ernanodonta (Ding, 1987)Malcolm C.
